i1.name: Headshot
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Caitlyn's''' basic attacks generate a stack of ''Count'' {{tip|on-attack}}, doubled when attacking from {{tip|brush}}. At 6 stacks, or 5 while in ''brush'', '''Caitlyn's''' next [[basic attack]] consumes all stacks to become a ''Headshot'': it has an {{tip|uncancelable windup}} and deals {{as|({{pp|key=%|50 to 100 for 3|1 to 13}}|ad}} {{as|+ {{critical damage|{{tt|109.375|62,5% multiplied by standard critical damage factor}}|62.5}} critical strike chance|critical chance}}{{as|) AD}} {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}}, increased to {{as|(100%|AD}} {{as|+ {{critical damage|{{tt|109.375|62,5% multiplied by standard critical damage factor}}|62.5}} critical strike chance|critical chance}}{{as|) AD}} against non-champions.
'''Caitlyn''' may fire more than one ''Headshot'' until it hits a target, which consumes all stacks.

Enemies that step over a {{ai|Yordle Snap Trap|Caitlyn}} or are hit by {{ai|90 Caliber Net|Caitlyn}} can grant an additional ''Headshot'' against them at {{sti|range|1300 range}} within {{fd|1.8}} seconds, without consuming stacks. Each method grants only one ''Headshot'' at a time.
i1.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Caitlyn's basic attacks generate a stack of Count on-attack, doubled when attacking from brush. At 6 stacks, or 5 while in brush, Caitlyn's next basic attack consumes all stacks to become a Headshot: it has an uncancelable windup and deals (1 to 13 â€’ undefined + (+ IE 25%) critical strike chance) AD bonus physical damage, increased to (100% + (+ IE 25%) critical strike chance) AD against non-champions.
Caitlyn may fire more than one Headshot until it hits a target, which consumes all stacks.
Enemies that step over a Caitlyn's Yordle Snap Trap or are hit by Caitlyn's 90 Caliber Net can grant an additional Headshot against them at 1300 range within 1.8 seconds, without consuming stacks. Each method grants only one Headshot at a time.
i1.notes:
* ''Headshot'' is consumed when the missile successfully hits the target.
* If '''Caitlyn's''' current target becomes trapped by {{ai|Yordle Snap Trap|Caitlyn}} or {{ai|90 Caliber Net|Caitlyn}} while her attack is on cooldown, this ongoing cooldown will be refunded partially so that her next attack on them can begin earlier.
** Swapping the target to an enemy trapped by {{ai|Yordle Snap Trap|Caitlyn}} or {{ai|90 Caliber Net|Caitlyn}} also reduces her ongoing attack cooldown.
*** {{pending for test}}: The exact attack cooldown refund appears to be 50% of the attack cooldown at current attack speed, but at a minimum amount it lets '''Caitlyn''' start the attack against the trapped target within {{fd|0.5}} seconds of her previous attack windup completing.
* The bonus range from {{ii|Rapid Firecannon}} will not have any effect during {{ai|Yordle Snap Trap|Caitlyn|trap}} and {{ai|90 Caliber Net|Caitlyn|net}} extended ''Headshot'' attacks.
* Only the ordinary {{as|100% attack damage}} portion of the attack can critically strike. The bonus from ''Headshot'' is added after the critical strike is rolled.
** The full damage of ''Headshot'' applies {{stil|life steal}}.
** ''Headshot'' is a single instance of damage, thus does not trigger {{cais|Tantrum|Amumu}} or {{iis|Warden's Mail}} passives twice.
* Attacking {{tip|ward|wards}} or [[jungle plants]] will still generate stacks towards ''Headshot'' but the empowered attack will not be consumed.
* The basic attack triggering ''Headshot'' can {{tip|critically strike}}, but ''Headshot's'' damage remains unchanged if it does.
* Since '''Caitlyn's''' Art and Sustainability Update, Ability-granted ''Headshots'' are the same as the original ''Headshot'' override attack, though what lets them cast at high range is still relatively special. They trigger [[on-attack]] effects (including stacking ''Headshot'').
** {{Pending for test}} {{iis|Runaan's Hurricane}} {{nie|Wind's Fury}}, is special cased to search targets with the increased range as well.
* The bonus damage applies to {{tip|turret|turrets}}.
* Because ''Headshot'' stacks are generated [[on-attack]], {{ii|Runaan's Hurricane}} bolts will not generate stacks towards ''Headshot''.

q1.name: Piltover_Peacemaker
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Caitlyn''' fires a piercing shot in the target direction that deals {{as|physical damage}} to the first enemy it passes through, after which it expands in width but deals only 50% damage to enemies it passes thereafter.
Enemies {{tip|true sight|revealed}} by {{ai|Yordle Snap Trap|Caitlyn}} always take {{ccs|full damage|physical}} from ''Piltover Peacemaker''.
q1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Caitlyn fires a piercing shot in the target direction that deals physical damage to the first enemy it passes through, after which it expands in width but deals only 50% damage to enemies it passes thereafter.
Enemies revealed by Caitlyn's Yordle Snap Trap always take Unknown value: ccs / full damage / physical from Piltover Peacemaker.
q1.notes:
* Enemies hit while protected by a {{tip|spell shield}} will still be considered a target for calculating damage for subsequent hits.
{{Effect at cast time start}}

effects.str:
• Physical Damage: (+ % AD)
  • Reduced Damage: (+ % AD)

w1.name: Yordle_Snap_Trap
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Caitlyn''' periodically [[stock]]s a ''Yordle Snap Trap'' charge, up to a maximum amount.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Caitlyn''' sets a visible {{tip|untargetable}} trap at the target location which grants {{tip|sight}} of the area for 1 second and arms after 1 second, lasting for a duration. After the maximum amount of traps is laid down, deploying another immediately destroys the oldest one.

The next enemy champion that springs the trap is {{tip|root|rooted}} for {{fd|1.5}} seconds, {{tip|true sight|revealed}} for 3 seconds, takes additional damage from {{ai|Headshot|Caitlyn}}, and becomes immune to further ''Yordle Snap Traps'' for 3 seconds.
w1.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Caitlyn periodically stocks a Yordle Snap Trap charge, up to a maximum amount.
Active: Caitlyn sets a visible untargetable trap at the target location which grants sight of the area for 1 second and arms after 1 second, lasting for a duration. After the maximum amount of traps is laid down, deploying another immediately destroys the oldest one.
The next enemy champion that springs the trap is rooted for 1.5 seconds, revealed for 3 seconds, takes additional damage from Caitlyn's Headshot, and becomes immune to further Yordle Snap Traps for 3 seconds.
w1.notes:
* {{pending for test|Immunity vs {{tip|Airborne}} moveblocks and {{tip|Kinematics}}?}}
* If multiple traps are placed under an enemy, they will spring one at a time.

effects.str: • Caitlyn's Headshot Damage Increase: (+ % bonus AD)

e1.name: 90_Caliber_Net
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Caitlyn''' fires a net in the target direction and {{tip|dash|recoils}} 390 units in the opposite direction. The net deals {{as|magic damage}} to the first enemy hit and {{tip|slow|slows}} them by 50% for 1 second.
'''Caitlyn''' will not dash backwards if she is {{tip|immobilize|immobilized}} or {{tip|ground|grounded}} during the cast time.
'''Caitlyn''' can cast any of her abilities while {{tip|dash|dashing}}.
e1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Caitlyn fires a net in the target direction and recoils 390 units in the opposite direction. The net deals magic damage to the first enemy hit and slows them by 50% for 1 second.
Caitlyn will not dash backwards if she is immobilized or grounded during the cast time.
Caitlyn can cast any of her abilities while dashing.

r1.name: Ace_in_the_Hole
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Caitlyn''' locks onto the target enemy champion and {{tip|channel|channels}} for 1 second, telegraphing a trajectory that {{tip|true sight|reveals}} them as well as {{tip|sight|reveals}} herself.
''Ace in the Hole'' is placed on a 5-second {{sti|cooldown}} if canceled.
Once '''Caitlyn''' completes the channel, she fires a homing bullet toward the target that deals {{as|physical damage}} to the first enemy champion it hits.
r1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Caitlyn locks onto the target enemy champion and channels for 1 second, telegraphing a trajectory that reveals them as well as reveals herself.
Ace in the Hole is placed on a 5-second cooldown if canceled.
Once Caitlyn completes the channel, she fires a homing bullet toward the target that deals physical damage to the first enemy champion it hits.
r1.notes:
* The following will cancel ''Ace in the Hole's'' channel (mana expenditure is not compensated):
** '''Caitlyn''' is {{tip|interrupt|interrupted}}.
** The target becomes {{tip|untargetable}}.
** '''Caitlyn''' or her target {{tip|death|dies}}.
** '''Caitlyn''' uses {{si|Flash}}.
* ''Ace in the Hole'' reveals the target and '''Caitlyn''' through a buff that lasts for up to 4 seconds.
** The buff is applied to the target from the start of the cast time.
** The buff ends prematurely when the channel is canceled or the bullet hits an enemy.
*** The target is revealed for 1 second if the buff is ended prematurely.
*** It is not removed if the cast time is cancelled or the bullet missile is destroyed.{{bug|2}}
* The ability also goes on a 5-second {{sti|cooldown}} if '''Caitlyn''' enters {{tip|resurrection}} during the cast time.
** The cast time does not end prematurely but the channel will be immediately canceled the moment the cast time completes.
* If the target dies after the bullet has been fired, the shot will continue towards their corpse and may still hit other enemy champions.
* The bullet has a {{tip|sight}} radius of 1500 attached to it.
{{Unit-targeted cancel conditions}}** This excludes losing sight of the target.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Caitlyn''' is {{tip|channel|channeling}}:
